text: Mercedes de Acosta (March 1, 1893 â€“ May 9, 1968) was an American poet, novelist and playwright. She wrote four famous stage plays. She also published three volumes of poetry and one novel. That novel was not a success, though it did create controversy because of its lesbian themed subject. De Acosta was born in New York City. She died there at age seventy-five. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America Category:1893 births Category:1968 deaths Category:American novelists Category:American playwrights Category:American poets Category:Writers from New York City
title: Mercedes de Acosta
